title: Circular 13: The Magazine of the Typographic Circle (Typeface Query)
content:
Hello,

I came across this magazine and immediately fell in love with the arrangement of the type on the cover, - so much so that I took a photo of it with my phone.

I’m now curious as to what the typeface may be or preferably if there is anything similar?

It could be a customized typeface?

Any suggestions are appreciated.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Untitled-3.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924105642/http:/typophile.com/files/Untitled-3_2.jpg) | 39.29 KB |

 [‹ Font Identification](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924105642/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45211 "Go to previous forum topic") [ID Help! ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924105642/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45153 "Go to next forum topic")
author: AlyssaBarnes

comments.content:
Lux Sans is very close.

The “i” in “Cir” looks like it was taken from an italicized “i” and rotated to fit in the graphic.

[http://vllg.com/Lux/LuxSans/mudTyper+Weights/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924105642/http:/vllg.com/Lux/LuxSans/mudTyper+Weights/ "http://vllg.com/Lux/LuxSans/mudTyper+Weights/")

Mikey :-)

Thank you both for replying, I’m grateful. :) - Lux Sans is very close but after comparing Plume in Bold, it certainly seems identical. That’s fantastic, really, thanks again.

Oh. and I’m going to be extra cheeky and post another request (likely to be my last for a while)...
